titleStmt.title: The praise of the gout, or, The gouts apologie A paradox, both pleasant and profitable. Written first in the Latine tongue, by that famous and noble gentleman Bilibaldus Pirckheimerus councellor vnto two emperours, Maximilian the first, and Charles the fift: and now Englished by William Est, Master of Arts.
Apologia seu podagrae laus. English
titleStmt.author: Pirckheimer, Willibald, 1470-1530.

titleStmt.title: The praise of the gout, or, The gouts apologie A paradox, both pleasant and profitable. Written first in the Latine tongue, by that famous and noble gentleman Bilibaldus Pirckheimerus councellor vnto two emperours, Maximilian the first, and Charles the fift: and now Englished by William Est, Master of Arts.
Apologia seu podagrae laus. English
titleStmt.author: Pirckheimer, Willibald, 1470-1530.
Est, William, 1546 or 7-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by G[eorge] P[urslowe] for Iohn Budge, and are to be sold at his shop in Pauls Church-yard at the signe of the greene Dragon,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Apologia seu podagrae laus.
Running title reads: The gouts apologie.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
